snippet: Remember the days when the political conventions actually mattered?
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column argues that the bland Republican National Convention is a strong reminder that major party conventions now simply enforce the views of hard-liners while running through endless hours of pre-scripted events revolving around preordained candidates; yearns for the days before 1960 when conventions really mattered, rowdy competitions for the nomination that demanded the kind of compromise that is essential for governing.
lead_paragraph: Remember the days when the political conventions actually mattered?

headline.print_headline: They’re Not What They Used to Be
headline.seo: They’re Not What They Used to Be
headline.main: They’re Not What They Used to Be
